resources.string: Accidents may occur anywhere, anytime and with anyone but these can be prevented by following simple safety rules.
Every place has safety rules of its own, such as on the road, at school and at home.
We can get hurt easily if we are not careful while using roads. We must be aware of how to give first aid in an emergency.
SAFETY AT HOME AND AT SCHOOL
Though homes and schools are believed to be the safest places, accidents can occur there also. Some common reasons for accidents are:

Healthy food, good eating habits, regular exercise and proper rest and sleep are the keys to good health. We should avoid junk food as far as possible. Good health refers to the state of overall well-being of a person.
The key to good health lies in:
It is the first and intermediate help given to an injured or sick person, before the arrival of a doctor. It can save a person’s life if given properly. Some training is required to give first aid.
1. Do not gather around the victim when he/she is cut by sharp objects.
2. Do not panic, instead find some help. Call an adult and a doctor.
3. Make the injured person comfortable. Let him/her get proper rest.
\u2022 It is better to cross the road at a zebra crossing (pedestrian crossing) or by a subway or a foot over bridge.
\u2022 Don’t forget to wear a seat belt.
We must ensure safety at home and at school
\u2022Keep sharp objects out of reach of small children for safety.
\u2022Do not play with things made up of glass as these can break easily.
\u2022We should not jump off a moving swing or ride.
\u2022Do not play or run up and down on the stairs.
We must know how to give first aid.
Electric shock can be a fatal accident. The following measures must be taken to prevent electric shocks:
\u2022Never touch any electric switch or wire with wet hands or when standing barefoot on a wet floor.
Healthy and clean food gives energy and nutrients to the body. This keeps us in good health and keep us fit and protect us against various diseases.
We should also take out time to relax ourselves by taking a short nap in the day. Our body gets time to repair the wear and tear when we sleep and this ensures safety.
